title: Yuku.
content:
"Important ezAnnouncement: Next generation of ezboard: yuku. [url=http://help.yuku.com/About_yuku]Find out what it's all about here.[/url]"

So uh, is the PCKF switching to this automatically? Or can it be moved to this newer board system? If so, maybe it should be considered; I personally would like to see a more modern forum system for the PCKF sometime.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: like rats off a ship...
content:
Oh, gross. Alright, all you EzBoard-hating people, that convinced me... we need to move someplace better. *sigh*

That Yuku stuff looks obnoxious.

title: Yuck
content:
Even the name sounds gross...

I don't know, this looks interesting.

title: Re: Yuck
content:
I'm afraid soon there'll be no board that doesn't have all the bells and whistles. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Yuck
content:
I have a feeling that ezBoard will soon be consigned to the end-of-life bin, and that we'll encounter frequent spots of downtime (and possibly even sporadic data loss) interspersed with messages encouraging us to upgrade to Yuku. We really should get around to moving sometime, considering that the possibility has been floating about since 2005 or so :P

EDIT: Yuku does have a few good features (working search, for example) but it would nonetheless be better to move to our own host.

title: ugh
content: But have you seen the MySpace-style profiles?  Really not what I'm looking for in a message board.

title: Re: ugh
content:
Hey, I was just wondering if an upgrade was possible, especially there are some inconveniences in the current ezboard. And bandwidth- (and time-) saving stuff like quick reply and quick edit are pretty useful, too.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
